stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.

Tugging on their left earlobe three times.

stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.

preGame:
üéôÔ∏è **GOOD EVENING, OSTERRA!** This is Nok the Corrupter, your voice of violence, coming to you LIVE for another blood-soaked edition of **Tuesday Night Trollball!** We are broadcasting from the sweltering, unforgiving dunes of the Great Desert at the **Sun-Baked Bowl**! ‚òÄÔ∏è It is hot, it is sandy, and folks, the air is absolutely shimmering with heat waves and bad intentions! 

Tonight, we have a clash that promises to be as gritty as the sand in your teeth! In the visiting corner, emerging from the fog and ruins, we have **The Kerlauger Runeguard**! üå´Ô∏è Rumor has it these folks are associated with the White Ravens‚Äîhello to Dame Terra, keep doing your dirty work, my dear! I saw **Harilda Sigsmond** down on the field earlier leading a synchronized chant that got louder and louder until my ears started ringing! That is the kind of psychological warfare I love to see! And let's not forget **Vivia Namara**, who was literally slapping themself in the face to get hyped. That is dedication to the pain! üò§

Facing them, defending their sandy turf, are **The Desert Spectres**! üíÄ Associates of Geth the Gravelord‚Äîa skeleton of taste, if I do say so myself. I caught **Steve**‚Äîjust Steve‚Äîorganizing a betting pool on the sidelines about who draws first blood. I put five gold pieces on "everyone." And look at **Angelita Darce**, who shaved half their mustache for luck. It looks ridiculous. I love it! üòÇ

But wait, there is a twist! üö® The commissioners have declared this an **OPEN BAR MATCH**! üç∫üç∑ That is right! The kegs are tapped, the spirits are high, and by the fourth quarter, we expect the coordination to be at an all-time low! Will the heat dehydrate them, or will the ale drown them? Let‚Äôs find out! Grab a cold one, folks, because **IT‚ÄôS TROLLBALL TIME!** üëπüèà
postGame:
üèÅ **AND THAT IS THE GAME!** The dust has settled, the sun has set, and the hangovers are already beginning! üåô The **Kerlauger Runeguard** have marched into the desert and pitched a shutout, defeating **The Desert Spectres** with a final score of **3 to 0**! üèÜ What a display of drunken dominance!

The match started fast and furious! **Harilda Sigsmond** snagged that Trollball early, and the violence was instantaneous. We saw **Lashondra Niehaus** absolutely CRUSH Lovash Marius into the sand‚ÄîINJURY number one, folks! üöë That is how you start a Tuesday! But the Spectres bit back, with **Shelman McQuoid** taking Reginauld Cordell out of the equation temporarily. A tit-for-tat exchange of bodily harm! üí•

Despite the heat, **Shepperd Trefler** of the Runeguard kept a cool head‚Äîwell, until the ale hit him later. He found a lane, dodged the clumsy tackle attempts of the Spectres, and **DUNKED** that leather head right into the basket! üèÄ **1-0 Runeguard!** And you know what that means? **DRINK!** üçª The alcohol started flowing, and the coordination started dropping immediately.

The violence from Kerlauger was relentless! **Lorilee Aldred** decided that scoring wasn't enough and flattened Fidellia Mozelle, sending them to the healer's tent. ‚õ∫ And **Harilda Sigsmond**? An absolute unit today! Harilda took out Huesman Ring AND Muscolo Jaehne in quick succession! It was like bowling with bodies out there! üé≥ The Spectres' healer, Verlee Dacia, was working overtime while the rest of the team was working on their buzz.

We went into halftime with the Runeguard up by one, and the Spectres looking thirsty‚Äîand I don't mean for water! üèúÔ∏è After the break, the players stumbled back onto the field, injuries magically knitted but livers heavily taxed. **Vivia Namara** wasted no time adding to the casualty list, planting Shelman McQuoid into the dune face-first. INJURY! ü§ï

Then came the play of the game! üåü **Lorilee Aldred**, looking a bit tipsy and swaying in the wind, launched a Shoot from Home Field! It arced through the shimmering heat, defied physics and sobriety, and **SCORED!** üéØ That is 2 points, bringing the lead to **3-0**! The crowd went wild, or maybe they just passed out from heatstroke! Who cares!

By the late game, it was absolute chaos. **Bahr Ethelstan** was stumbling around like a zombie‚ÄîGeth would be proud‚Äîand **Reginauld Cordell** was absolutely WASTED. ü•¥ But drunken strength is still strength! Reginauld, barely able to stand, managed to tackle Heyes Iver and **INJURE** them! How do you tackle someone when you can see three of them? You tackle the one in the middle! Brilliant strategy! üß†

The Spectres tried to mount a comeback, with **Muscolo Jaehne** and **Heyes Iver** trying to run the ball, but they were zig-zagging so much they probably ran an extra mile for nothing. üòÇ The Runeguard defense, led by a very blurry-eyed **Johnna Beetner**, held the line.

In the end, the **Kerlauger Runeguard** proved that they can hold their liquor better than the desert dwellers! The White Ravens should be proud; their training in those uneven ruins clearly prepares you for stumbling around drunk! ü¶Ö As for the Spectres... well, Geth might want to raise some players with higher tolerance next time.

This has been **Nok the Corrupter**, reminding you that whether you win or lose, it doesn't matter as long as someone gets hurt! See you next Tuesday! üëãüòà
